subject: AI & Agents
title: The Problem with Predictive Policing
description: One-minute skill: The Problem with Predictive Policing.

hook.text: An AI tells police to patrol a neighborhood more. Arrests go up. The AI says 'see, I was right.'

buildup.text: Predictive policing uses historical crime data to forecast where crimes will occur.

discovery.text: But historical data reflects where police looked hardest, not where crime actually happens most.

twist.text: More patrols in an area find more crime. This feeds back into the model, creating a vicious cycle.

climax.text: Los Angeles and other cities abandoned predictive policing after studies exposed the feedback loop.

punchline.text: The algorithm didn't predict crime. It perpetuated policing patterns.

quiz.question: What is the main problem with predictive policing?
options: It creates feedback loops from biased historical data
It is too expensive to implement
Criminals learn to avoid predicted areas
